workflow.name: Generate articles from Google Sheets to WordPress with web scraping and GPT-4 Mini
workflow.description:
## ü§ñ Automated AI Article Generation from Google Sheets to WordPress

### üìù Short Description
Transform a Google Sheet into an automated content factory! This workflow reads article topics, scrapes source content, uses AI to create original articles, and publishes drafts to WordPress automatically. üöÄ

### üìñ Full Description
This workflow automates the entire content creation pipeline by connecting Google Sheets, web scraping, AI content generation, and WordPress publishing. It's designed for content marketers, bloggers, and news publishers who need to scale their content production efficiently. üí™

The system monitors a Google Sheet for new article ideas, processes source URLs through a dual-AI system for summarization and content creation, then automatically generates WordPress drafts while tracking everything back to the spreadsheet. üìä‚Üíü§ñ‚Üíüåê

## üë• Who's It For

- **üìà Content marketing agencies** managing multiple clients
- **‚úçÔ∏è Bloggers** looking to scale their content output
- **üì∞ News publishers** automating article aggregation
- **üîç SEO specialists** creating keyword-optimized content
- **üéØ Digital marketers** running content campaigns

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

1. **üìä Sheet Monitoring**: Watches Google Sheets for rows marked "New" in the Flow Status column
2. **üîç Content Processing**: Fetches and analyzes source articles using dual AI agents
3. **ü§ñ Article Generation**: Creates SEO-optimized articles with proper formatting and structure
4. **üåê WordPress Integration**: Automatically publishes drafts to your WordPress site
5. **‚úÖ Status Tracking**: Updates the sheet with progress and final draft links

## üõ†Ô∏è How to Set Up

### üìã Prerequisites
- üîê Google Sheets API access (OAuth2)
- üß† OpenAI API key
- üåê WordPress REST API credentials
- üîó Source URLs for article inspiration

### ‚ö° Configuration Steps
1. **üîÑ Clone the workflow** into your n8n instance
2. **üîó Connect credentials** for Google Sheets, OpenAI, and WordPress
3. **üìÑ Update the Google Sheet ID** in all Sheet nodes to point to your document
4. **üìä Configure the sheet columns** to match: Topic, Source, Flow Status, Publish Status, Publish Link
5. **üß™ Test with one row** marked as "New" in your sheet

## üìã Requirements

### üß© n8n Nodes Used
- üìä Google Sheets (read/update operations)
- üåê HTTP Request (web scraping)
- ü§ñ OpenAI/LangChain (AI content processing)
- üåê WordPress (draft creation)
- üíª Code node (content formatting)
- ‚öñÔ∏è If node (error handling)
- üîÑ SplitInBatches (item processing)

### ‚òÅÔ∏è External Services
- üìä Google Sheets with specific column structure
- üß† OpenAI API access
- üåê WordPress installation with REST API enabled

## üé® How to Customize the Workflow

### ‚úçÔ∏è Content Style Adjustments
Modify the "Article Creator" AI node's system prompt to change:
- üé≠ Writing tone and style
- üîç SEO keyword density
- üìë Article structure and headings
- üí¨ Call-to-action format

### üîç Source Processing
Adjust the "Article Summarizer" node to:
- üï∏Ô∏è Handle different website structures
- üìù Extract specific content elements
- üìã Modify markdown output format

### üì§ Publishing Options
Customize the "Create a Draft" WordPress node to:
- üìù Change post status from "draft" to "publish"
- üë• Assign different authors or categories
- üè∑Ô∏è Add custom fields or tags

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Error Handling
Modify the conditional logic in the "If" node to handle different failure scenarios or add additional validation steps.

---

**‚ÑπÔ∏è Note**: This workflow uses community nodes (LangChain/OpenAI) and requires a self-hosted n8n instance.

*‚ú® Workflow features comprehensive error handling, real-time status tracking, and batch processing for efficient content pipeline management.*

workflow.name: ü§ñ Automated AI Article Generation from Google Sheets to WordPressnail

value.Publish Status: Not Processed Because of an Error

parameters.content:
## ü§ñ These Two AI Brother is creating the Article ‚úå
- Article Summarizer
- Article Creator

values.content:
=Generate a news article about the given Source Data
The article should follow this format and structure:
- **Headline:** Create an SEO-optimized headline that includes the keywords from the topic title.
- **Location Line:** Immediately after the headline, include a **location line** (e.g., **"San Francisco, CA ‚Äì"**) and **bold the location**.
- **Introduction:** Write a strong, engaging introduction summarizing the key point of the article in one to two paragraphs. Make sure it captures the reader's attention.
- **Main Headings Based on Content:**
  - Instead of predefined subheadings, **generate the main headings** based on the **content of the article**. For example:
    1. If the article is about a **discovery**, the main heading might be something like: **"The Unexpected Discovery"** or **"How the Discovery Was Made"**.
    2. If the article focuses on **reactions**, the main heading could be: **"Community Reactions and Expert Opinions"** or **"Public and Expert Responses"**.
    3. For articles related to **future implications** or **next steps**, the heading could be: **"What Happens Next?"** or **"Implications for the Future"**.
  - The key here is that the main headings should be **created based on the content** in the body, rather than following a rigid structure.
- **Body Content:**
  - The body of the article should flow logically, based on the content collected from the source. Each section should expand on the corresponding headings.
  - Ensure each section is fact-based, concise, well-researched, and provides relevant information. Use the extracted expert quotes where appropriate.
- **Bold Key Points:**  Make sure to bold any important names, figures, dates, or key terms that require emphasis. Additionally, bold around 15% of the most important words in the article to highlight the key information and ensure clarity.
- **Bullet Points:** Use bullet points to highlight key facts, data, trends, or recommendations within the article. Bullet points should break down complex information into digestible chunks.
- **Blockquotes:** Include blockquotes for any expert opinions, quotes, or statements that should be emphasized.
- **Source Integration:** Integrate the provided **source link** **only once** within the article body. It should be referenced naturally, in a relevant section like background information, expert quotes, or statistics.
- **Customized Call-to-Action (CTA):** At the end of the article, include a **customized CTA** based on the article's content. For example, if the article is about a discovery, the CTA could be:
  - **"What do you think about this discovery? Have you ever visited Crater of Diamonds State Park? Share your thoughts in the comments below!"**
- **SEO Optimization:** Ensure the article includes relevant keywords naturally throughout the text, in headings and body content, to avoid keyword stuffing while making sure the text flows naturally.

**Output Format:**

```json
{
  "title": "the original title here",
  "content": "the fully written HTML article here"
}
```

=You are a data extraction AI tasked with processing HTML content. Your goal is to identify and extract the title and the main text content from the provided HTML document. Follow these specific instructions: 1. **Input Format:** You will receive a well-formed HTML document as input. 2. **Output Format:** Your output should be in Markdown format. 3. **Content Extraction:** - Extract the title of the article from the `` tag or the main heading tag (e.g., `<h1>`). - Extract the main body of the article excluding any images, external links, or other media. Focus solely on the text content. 4. **Markdown Guidelines:** - The title should be formatted as a top-level heading (using `#`). - The main body text should follow the title in plain Markdown format, preserving paragraphs, lists, and any other textual formatting present in the HTML. 5. **Restrictions:** - Do not include any images, external links, or HTML tags in your output. - Ensure that the extracted text is coherent and maintains the context of the original content. Example Input: ```html <html> <head> <title>Sample Article Title

Sample Article Title

This is the first paragraph of the article.

This is the second paragraph with an external link.

``` Expected Output: ``` # Sample Article Title This is the first paragraph of the article with information. This is the second paragraph of the article with information. ``` Process the provided HTML input according to these instructions and generate the desired Markdown output.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
